title: Establishes the veterans' special disability fund to provide incentives to employers to hire veterans who were previously injured during active military duty
summary: Establishes the veterans' special disability fund to provide incentives to employers to hire veterans who were previously injured during active military duty.

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. ORTIZ, SCARBOROUGH, SCHROEDER, PERRY, LUPARDO,
         BENEDETTO,  COOK,  GUNTHER,  COLTON,  N. RIVERA,  CUSICK,  SCHIMEL  --
         Multi-Sponsored  by  --  M.  of  A.    ABBATE, BOYLAND, CAHILL, CLARK,
         JACOBS, JAFFEE,  V. LOPEZ,  MAISEL,  MILLMAN,  NOLAN,  PEOPLES-STOKES,
         PHEFFER,  REILLY,  ROBINSON,  SWEENEY,  WEISENBERG  --  read  once and
         referred to the Committee on Labor

       AN ACT to amend the workers' compensation law, in relation to establish-
         ing the veterans' special disability fund  to  provide  incentives  to
         employers  to  hire  veterans who have sustained an injury or physical
         impairment during military active duty

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Clause (A) of subparagraph 2 of paragraph (h) of subdivi-
    2  sion 8 of section 15 of the workers' compensation  law,  as  amended  by
    3  chapter  6  of  the laws of 2007, is amended and a new subparagraph 8 is
    4  added to read as follows:
    5    (A) No carrier or employer, or the state insurance fund,  may  file  a
    6  claim  for reimbursement from the special disability fund, for an injury
    7  or illness with a date of accident or date of disablement  on  or  after
    8  July  first,  two  thousand  seven UNLESS SUCH CLAIM SEEKS REIMBURSEMENT
    9  PURSUANT TO THE VETERANS' SPECIAL  DISABILITY  FUND  AS  ESTABLISHED  IN
   10  SUBPARAGRAPH  EIGHT  OF THIS PARAGRAPH.   No carrier or employer, or the
   11  state insurance fund, may  file  a  claim  for  reimbursement  from  the
   12  special disability fund after July first, two thousand ten, and no writ-
   13  ten  submissions or evidence in support of such a claim may be submitted
   14  after that date.
   15    (8)(A) ON OR AFTER JULY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND ELEVEN,  AN  EMPLOYER,  OR
   16  THE  EMPLOYER'S  INSURANCE  CARRIER,  MAY FILE A CLAIM FOR REIMBURSEMENT
   17  FROM THE VETERANS' SPECIAL DISABILITY FUND, AS ESTABLISHED IN CLAUSE (D)
   18  OF THIS SUBPARAGRAPH, FOR WAGES PAID TO A CLAIMANT FOR  PERMANENT  TOTAL

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03701-01-1

       A. 887                              2

    1  OR  PARTIAL  DISABILITY OF THE CLAIMANT. SUCH CLAIM MAY BE FILED REGARD-
    2  LESS OF THE DATE SUCH INJURY, IMPAIRMENT OR DISABLEMENT WAS SUSTAINED BY
    3  THE VETERAN.
    4    (B) AN EMPLOYER OR INSURANCE CARRIER SHALL BE FULLY REIMBURSED FOR THE
    5  TOTAL  WAGES  PAID  TO  A  CLAIMANT  FOR  THE TOTAL PERIOD OF DISABILITY
    6  RESULTING FROM THE COMPENSABLE INJURY SUSTAINED BY SUCH CLAIMANT  DURING
    7  EMPLOYMENT  AND  SUCH  COMPENSATION TO THE CLAIMANT, OR REIMBURSEMENT TO
    8  SUCH EMPLOYER, SHALL EQUAL THE TOTAL WAGES PAID UNDER THE AWARD SCHEDULE
    9  OF COMPENSATION FOR PERMANENT TOTAL DISABILITY AS IS PRESCRIBED IN  THIS
   10  SECTION.
   11    (C)  AN  EMPLOYER  SHALL BE ENTITLED TO SUCH REIMBURSEMENT IF: (I) THE
   12  CLAIMANT SUSTAINED AN INJURY OR PHYSICAL IMPAIRMENT DURING ACTIVE  MILI-
   13  TARY  DUTY  PRIOR  TO  EMPLOYMENT,  (II)  THE  EMPLOYER WAS AWARE OF THE
   14  PRE-EXISTING INJURY OR IMPAIRMENT UPON HIRING THE CLAIMANT AND (III) THE
   15  PRE-EXISTING INJURY OR IMPAIRMENT MATERIALLY AND SUBSTANTIALLY  RESULTED
   16  IN THE PERMANENT COMPENSABLE DISABILITY OF THE CLAIMANT.
   17    (D)  A  FUND IS HEREBY ESTABLISHED UNDER THE AUSPICES OF THE BOARD AND
   18  THE DEPARTMENT OF TAXATION AND FINANCE TO RETAIN THE LIABILITIES CHARGE-
   19  ABLE UNDER THIS CLAUSE. THE SAID FUND SHALL BE KNOWN AND REFERRED TO  AS
   20  THE  "VETERANS' SPECIAL DISABILITY FUND" AND SHALL BE AVAILABLE ONLY FOR
   21  THE PURPOSES STATED WITHIN THIS CLAUSE, AND  THE  ASSETS  OF  SAID  FUND
   22  SHALL  NOT  AT  ANY TIME BE APPROPRIATED OR DIVERTED TO ANY OTHER USE OF
   23  PURPOSE. SUCH FUND SHALL BE MAINTAINED AND PROVIDED FOR BY THE BOARD AND
   24  THE DEPARTMENT OF TAXATION AND FINANCE  COLLECTIVELY.  THE  CHAIR  SHALL
   25  ASSESS UPON AND COLLECT FROM EACH INSURANCE CARRIER, INCLUDING THE STATE
   26  INSURANCE  FUND,  AND ANY COUNTY, CITY, TOWN, VILLAGE OR OTHER POLITICAL
   27  SUBDIVISION FAILING TO SECURE COMPENSATION, A SUM EQUAL TO A PERCENTAGE,
   28  OF THE TOTAL COMPENSATION PAID BY INSURANCE CARRIERS FOR THE YEAR ENDING
   29  MARCH THIRTY-FIRST NEXT PRECEDING THE DATE OF SUCH ASSESSMENT.
   30    (I) THE CHAIR AND THE  COMMISSIONER  OF  TAXATION  AND  FINANCE  SHALL
   31  DETERMINE  THE  EXACT  RATE  OF  ASSESSMENT TO BE MADE AGAINST INSURANCE
   32  CARRIERS TO FUND THE VETERANS' SPECIAL DISABILITY FUND AND  SHALL  REAS-
   33  SESS  SUCH  ASSESSMENTS  ON  AN  ANNUAL BASIS. SUCH ASSESSMENTS SHALL BE
   34  INITIALLY BASED UPON THE ASSESSMENTS SET FORTH PURSUANT TO FORMER SUBDI-
   35  VISION EIGHT OF THIS SECTION AS IT  EXISTED  IMMEDIATELY  PRIOR  TO  THE
   36  EFFECTIVE DATE OF CHAPTER SIX OF THE LAWS OF TWO THOUSAND SEVEN. A CLAIM
   37  SOUGHT PURSUANT TO THIS CLAUSE SHALL COMPLY WITH ALL OTHER PROVISIONS OF
   38  THIS SECTION.
   39    (II)  THE  CHAIR  AND  THE  COMMISSIONER  OF  TAXATION AND FINANCE ARE
   40  FURTHER AUTHORIZED AND DIRECTED TO ENTER INTO FINANCIAL  AGREEMENTS  FOR
   41  THE  VETERANS' SPECIAL DISABILITY FUND. SUCH AN AGREEMENT SHALL BE KNOWN
   42  AND REFERRED TO AS THE  "VETERANS'  SPECIAL  DISABILITY  FUND  FINANCIAL
   43  AGREEMENT".
   44    (III) THE COMMISSIONER OF TAXATION AND FINANCE IS HEREBY AUTHORIZED TO
   45  RECEIVE  AND  CREDIT TO THE VETERANS' SPECIAL DISABILITY FUND ANY SUM OR
   46  SUMS WHICH MAY, AT ANY TIME, BE CONTRIBUTED TO THE STATE BY  THE  UNITED
   47  STATES  OF AMERICA UNDER ANY ACT OF CONGRESS, OR OTHERWISE, TO WHICH THE
   48  STATE MAY BE OR BECOME ENTITLED BY REASON OF ANY PAYMENTS  MADE  OUT  OF
   49  SUCH  FUND. THE COMMISSIONER OF TAXATION AND FINANCE SHALL BE THE CUSTO-
   50  DIAN OF SUCH FUND AND, UNLESS OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR  IN  THE  VETERANS'
   51  SPECIAL DISABILITY FUND FINANCING AGREEMENT, SHALL INVEST ANY SURPLUS OR
   52  RESERVE  MONEYS THEREOF IN SECURITIES WHICH CONSTITUTE LEGAL INVESTMENTS
   53  FOR SAVINGS BANKS UNDER THE LAWS OF THIS STATE AND IN  INTEREST  BEARING
   54  CERTIFICATES  OF  DEPOSIT OF A BANK OR TRUST COMPANY LOCATED AND AUTHOR-
   55  IZED TO DO BUSINESS IN THIS STATE OR OF A NATIONAL BANK LOCATED IN  THIS
   56  STATE  SECURED BY A PLEDGE OF DIRECT OBLIGATIONS OF THE UNITED STATES OR

       A. 887                              3

    1  OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK IN AN  AMOUNT  EQUAL  TO  THE  AMOUNT  OF  SUCH
    2  CERTIFICATES  OF  DEPOSIT, AND MAY SELL ANY OF THE SECURITIES OR CERTIF-
    3  ICATES OF DEPOSIT WHICH SUCH FUND IS INVESTED IF NECESSARY FOR THE PROP-
    4  ER  ADMINISTRATION  OR  IN THE BEST INTEREST OF SUCH FUND. DISBURSEMENTS
    5  FROM SUCH FUND AS PROVIDED PURSUANT TO THIS CLAUSE SHALL BE MADE BY  THE
    6  COMMISSIONER OF TAXATION AND FINANCE UPON VOUCHERS SIGNED BY THE CHAIR.
    7    S 2. The chair of the workers' compensation board and the commissioner
    8  of  taxation  and  finance  shall on the one hundred twentieth day after
    9  subparagraph 8 of paragraph (h) of subdivision 8 of section  15  of  the
   10  workers'  compensation  law  takes  effect,  determine  the  rate and/or
   11  percentage of compensation to be assessed and collected  upon  insurance
   12  carriers for the veterans' special disability fund.
   13    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   14  it  shall  have  become  a law; provided, however, that the chair of the
   15  workers' compensation board and the commissioner of taxation and finance
   16  shall be authorized and directed to promulgate any  rules  and/or  regu-
   17  lations  necessary  for  the implementation of this act on or before its
   18  effective date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the workers' compensation law, in relation to establishing the veterans' special disability fund to provide incentives to employers to hire veterans who have sustained an injury or physical impairment during military active duty
